chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp

Premises:
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
Zp_plus_comm : forall x y, x ⊕ y = y ⊕ x
Zp_plus_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊕ y ⊕ z
Zp_inj : forall x y, proj1_sig x = proj1_sig y -> x = y
inj_eq : forall x y : nat, x = y -> Z.of_nat x = Z.of_nat y
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
Nat.odd_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (EQ : x = x') => (fun lemma : Nat.odd x = Nat.odd x' <-> (Nat.odd x = true <-> Nat.odd x' = true) => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (Nat.odd x = Nat.odd x') (Nat.odd x = true <-> Nat.odd x' = true) lemma) (Bool.eq_iff_eq_true (Nat.odd x) (Nat.odd x')) ((fun lemma : Nat.odd x = true <-> Nat.Odd x => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (Nat.odd x = true) (Nat.Odd x) lemma (Nat.odd x' = true) (Nat.odd x' = true) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (Nat.odd x' = true))) (Nat.odd_spec x) ((fun lemma : Nat.odd x' = true <-> Nat.Odd x' => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER RelationClasses.iff_equivalence) (Nat.odd x' = true)...
lt_pirr : forall (x y : nat) (H1 H2 : x < y), H1 = H2
Zp_one = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) (rem 1 p) (div_rem_spec2 1 Hp) : Z_Zp
Nat.divmod_spec : forall x y q u : nat, u <= y -> let (q', u') := Nat.divmod x y q u in x + S y * q + (y - u) = S y * q' + (y - u') /\ u' <= y
BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat = fun x : positive => BinPosDef.Pos.iter_op Init.Nat.add x 1 : positive -> nat Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat _%positive_scope : simpl never
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
div_of_0 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> div 0 p = 0
Nat.log2_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') => let o : x <= 0 \/ 0 < x := Nat.le_gt_cases x 0 in match o with | or_introl H => (fun lemma : Nat.log2 x = 0 => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive (Nat.log2 x) 0 lemma (Nat.log2 x') (Nat.log2 x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (Nat.log2 x'))) (Nat.log2_nonpos x H) ((fun lemma : Nat.log2 x' = 0 => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (Nat.log2 x') 0 lemma) (Nat.log2_nonpos x' ((fun lemma : x = x' => Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.le_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation)) x' x (RelationClasses...
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
div_eq_0 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, n < p -> div n p = 0
Nat.add_sub_eq_nz : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n - m = p -> m + p = n
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Z_Zp = {x : nat | x < p} : Set
rem_plus_div : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a b : nat, divides p b -> rem a p = rem (a + b) p
Zp_zero = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) 0 ((fun lemma : 0 < p <-> (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 < p) (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z lt Z.of_nat Z.lt Nat2Z.inj_lt 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) Hp in let cstr : (0 <= Z.of_nat p)%Z := Nat2Z.is_nonneg p in let __arith : forall __x1 : Z, (0...
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y' = p * x')) (Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Trans...
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
BinPosDef.Pos.sub = fun x y : positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.sub_mask x y with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos z => z | _ => 1%positive end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.sub (_ _)%positive_scope
Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p = Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
rem_of_0 : forall p : nat, rem 0 p = 0
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
utils_nat.minimize : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall x : nat, P x \/ ~ P x) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> exists n : nat, P n /\ (forall i : nat, i < n -> ~ P i)

```coq
intros x.
unfold Zp.
rewrite Zp_plus_zero.
rewrite <- Zp_plus_zero with (x:=proj1_sig x).
apply Zp_inj.
simpl.
rewrite Zp_plus_zero.
induction (proj1_sig x).
- rewrite Zp_plus_zero.
  reflexivity.
- rewrite Zp_plus_zero.
  rewrite IHn.
  reflexivity.
Qed.```

original: intros x. unfold Zp. rewrite Zp_plus_zero. rewrite <- Zp_plus_zero with (x:=proj1_sig x). apply Zp_inj. simpl. rewrite Zp_plus_zero. induction (proj1_sig x). - rewrite Zp_plus_zero. reflexivity. - rewrite Zp_plus_zero. rewrite IHn. reflexivity.
